alert.note: Alert for Coconino (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued September 13 at 5:44PM MST until September 13 at 6:15PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 615 PM ARIZONA TIME /715 PM NAVAJO NATION TIME/ THIS EVENING FOR COCONINO COUNTY... At 542 PM Arizona Time /642 PM Navajo Nation Time/, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.5 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is likely ongoing, especially across low-lying areas and normally dry washes. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life-threatening flash flooding of low-water crossings, creeks, normally dry washes and roads. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Little CO River Gorge Overlook, Tappan Spring and Navajo Reservation. This includes the following swimming holes... Tappan Spring. This includes State Route 64 between mile markers 277 and 294. This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Needmore Wash, Lee Canyon, Cedar Wash, Little Colorado River, Burro Canyon Wash and Tappan Wash. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Remain alert for flooding even in locations not receiving rain. Normally dry washes, slot canyons and creeks can become raging killer currents in a matter of minutes, even from distant rainfall. Get out of washes and creeks if you are camping or hiking! Flooding is occurring or imminent and will inundate area drainages.
